posts.name: Chase Eid
posts.cooked:
We were doing a climb and wanted to know our cg. We were trying to think of ways to find it and then I remembered. Wii fit. The Wii fit board is able to find your balance during the body test. So I packed up my Wii-u (Wii should also work) and headed to the shop.

Once I got there we put a piece of wood on the board (square) and made a profile for the robot.  We put in the height of the robot for fun and put in the age but you cannot perform a body test on a one year old so we increased the age.

We began the body test and lifted the robot during the setup process (but left the wood) and then put it down when it told us to step on. We centered the robot on the board.

20250328_154600 1920×1081 263 KB

20250328_154600 1920×1081 263 KB

20250328_154600 1920×1081 263 KB

Fortunately the first thing was the center of balance test. They do not show you the balance live at first, but they record the movements and play them after. If your balance is significantly off, it will give you a live look at the CG for about 2 minutes and you are able to adjust any added weight till it’s centered. If not you will just have to keep repeating the process after it shows you the live view.

Our cg was off to the left . 20250328_154556 1920×1081 196 KB

20250328_154556 1920×1081 196 KB

20250328_154556 1920×1081 196 KB

We adjusted the weight during live mode until it was centered

20250329_082457(0) 1920×3410 555 KB

20250329_082457(0) 1920×3410 555 KB

20250329_082457(0) 1920×3410 555 KB

It also tells you the robot weight (and bmi) at the end

posts.name: evanperryg
posts.cooked:
How did you make sure the balance board was centered underneath the robot?

I feel like every Goodwill in the country has 8 balance boards that absolutely nobody wants. This would be a way to put a few of them to work.

posts.name: Maia
posts.cooked: We used to use this to weigh our robot!

posts.name: Chase Eid
posts.cooked: The board had a groove in the front and on the side which indicate the center and we lined it up with our bot
